description: From French margarique (in acide margarique), ultimately from Ancient Greek μάργαρον (márgaron, “pearl”).

adjectives.description: margaric (comparative more margaric, superlative most margaric)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to pearl or pearls (rare except in the designation of margaric acid)
examples: The men in her life were all swine before whom she'd cast the margaric treasures of her mind and body.
